title: Day 1.5: Jellyseerr Public Access via HTTPS
description: Enable public access to Jellyseerr on port 443 with valid Let's Encrypt certificates. Uses HAProxy SNI filtering, Cloudflare proxy (DDoS protection), and automated Ansible deployment. Goal: Enable Fidium ISP cancellation for 5.25/month savings.

title: Update PRD with resolved decisions (proxy mode + Ansible)
description: Update docs/PRD-day1.5.md with: 1) Cloudflare proxy mode for requests.theblueroost.me (proxied=true, Full strict SSL), 2) Ansible automation for Step 2 (remove manual steps), 3) Document caddy-jellyseerr role requirements
close_reason: PRD updated with both resolved decisions: Cloudflare proxy mode + Ansible automation

title: Remove ISP NAT rules and cancel Fidium service
description: Final business milestone: 1) Remove all port forwarding rules on home router (Plex, Jellyfin, etc.), 2) Verify services still accessible through bastion, 3) Contact Fidium ISP to cancel service, 4) Document cancellation confirmation and effective date. **Cost Savings: 5.25/month (03/year)**

title: Step 1: HAProxy SNI filtering and rate limiting
description: Configure HAProxy for port 443 with SNI filtering (allow only requests.theblueroost.me), rate limiting (20 conn/sec), enhanced logging, and no-SNI edge case handling. Update terraform/hetzner/firewall.tf and ansible/roles/haproxy templates.
close_reason: Infrastructure code complete: Cloudflare DNS with proxy mode, Hetzner firewall port 443, HAProxy SNI filtering with rate limiting

title: Step 1: Cloudflare DNS with proxy mode
description: Update terraform/cloudflare/dns.tf: Create requests.theblueroost.me A record with proxied=true (orange cloud), ttl=1. Add manual configuration step for Cloudflare Full (strict) SSL/TLS mode. Document why watch.theblueroost.me stays DNS-only.
close_reason: Infrastructure code complete: Cloudflare DNS with proxy mode, Hetzner firewall port 443, HAProxy SNI filtering with rate limiting

title: Step 1: Deploy infrastructure and validate
description: Backup terraform.tfstate, run deploy.sh, validate: HAProxy :443 listening, SNI filtering working, rate limiting active, DNS resolving through Cloudflare, Layer 7 health check passing (Jellyseerr API), no regression on Plex/Jellyfin.

title: Step 2: Create caddy-jellyseerr Ansible role
description: Create ansible/roles/caddy-jellyseerr with tasks: 1) Validate Caddy container exists, 2) Template Caddyfile (remove local_certs, add acme_dns cloudflare), 3) Add CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN to .env (lineinfile), 4) Update docker-compose.yml environment, 5) Restart Caddy. Include templates/Caddyfile.j2. Store in homelab-202512 repo, manage via ansible_connection: local.

title: Step 2: Test with Let's Encrypt staging
description: Update homeserver.yml playbook to include caddy-jellyseerr role. Run with staging ACME server first (acme-staging-v02.api.letsencrypt.org). Validate: DNS-01 challenge works, staging cert obtained, Caddy logs show success. Prevents production rate limiting risk.

title: Step 2: Deploy production certificates and validate
description: Switch Ansible role to production Let's Encrypt (remove acme_ca staging URL). Deploy via ansible-playbook. Validate: Production cert obtained, browser shows green padlock, no warnings, Layer 7 health check passes (/api/v1/status returns version), Cloudflare Full (strict) working, cert expiry 90 days.

title: Create validation scripts
description: Create scripts/test-sni-filter.sh with: SNI filtering test (allowed/rejected domains), Layer 7 health check (Jellyseerr API /api/v1/status), web UI test. Create scripts/validate-certificates.sh for cert validation. Make executable and add to git.

title: Monitor for 24-48 hours before ISP cancellation
description: Passive monitoring period: 1) Check HAProxy logs for rejected connections (false positives?), 2) Verify Jellyseerr accessible from mobile network, 3) Test rate limiting (simulate burst traffic), 4) Confirm Plex/Jellyfin still working, 5) Check Caddy auto-renewal scheduled. Document any issues in task comments before proceeding to ISP cancellation.
